Body:
The only scientific reason I can think of is that the death of a language deprives us of interesting information that could be used to research universal grammar, etc.

But the main reason is probably non-scientific, just as we don't like polar bears to go extinct or mediaeval churches to crumble: humanity has certain ideas about preserving the things it likes, and exotic languages are cool.

OwnerUser.AboutMe: I'm your dog for Dutch, Latin, and Greek.
